fields.description:
On a cluster built from latest trunk, click 'State' at application history webpage  gives following warning
 *DataTables warning (table id = 'apps'): Requested unknown parameter '9' from the data source for row 0*

and click 'Cluster' at RM applications page gives following warning

  !image-2018-07-09-12-09-21-401.png!
fields.summary: Incorrect sTarget column causing DataTable warning on RM application and scheduler web page and application history server webpage

comments.body:
This approach was introduced by YARN-3406.
YARN-7608 did a very similar fix to this one.
This shows that we have a problem maintaining this code as every time something is added this breaks.
We should add some unit test to make sure we have this working properly.

Agree with [~elgoiri] , we need to add some UTs to make sure this doesn't break in the future when new columns added. Changing this by manually counting and fixing the digits everytime is not a very good idea.

[~jutia] , could you add some UTs to this to address test4tests warmings? Thanks!
this is caused by YARN-7088 which adds a new column. there are some else places where the digits are manually counted, for example NodesPage.java. Maybe unified UTs are needed.

Yes, same thing for NodesPage very easy to break.
Ideally, we should even check that the type is the correct; for example if the table defines column X as sortable, we should check that it does so.
However, the latter is a little too complex.
At least a basic check that the numbers match should be there.
